questions.question: I will phone you when I ……………………
questions.description: When both clauses refer to the future, we use the simple present in the subordinate clause.

questions.question: He told me that he ……………………….. me.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, we use a past tense in the subordinate clause as well.

questions.question: People disliked her because she ………………………. arrogant.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, we use a past tense in the subordinate clause as well.

questions.question: We brought the food and they …………………………. the tickets.
She was rich and famous but few people ………………………… her.
questions.description: Like is not normally used in the continuous form.

questions.question: I waited for hours so that I ……………………………… her.
I went to bed early because I ………………………. not feeling well.
If you need help, just ………………………….. me a call.
While I ………………………….. a shower, I slipped on the floor.
questions.description: We use the past continuous for a longer background action that was going on while another action interrupted it.

questions.question: He talks as if he ………………………….. rich but he isn’t.
questions.description: We use a past tense with a present meaning after as if and as though to show that a comparison is unreal.

questions.question: As well as …………………………. his knee, he broke his arm.
questions.description: When we put a verb after as well as, we most often use the ing form.

questions.question: While you ……………………………. TV, I was working.
questions.description: Progressive forms are used in both clauses to talk about two actions that go on at the same time.
